# The `ScalarNode` Class Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

A scalar node is an opaque datum that can be presented as a series of zero or more Unicode scalar values. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

A scalar node is an opaque datum that can be presented as a series of zero or more Unicode scalar values.

Example: Adena

Definition at line 212 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/yamlparser-h">YAMLParser.h</a>.

### getValue() {#ac9af86d6008d075a0bd93e2357433ad3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StringRef ScalarNode::getValue (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; char &gt; &amp; Storage) const</>}>
Gets the value of this node as a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a>.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="Storage">is used to store the content of the returned <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> if it requires any modification from how it appeared in the source. This happens with escaped characters and multi-line literals.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
